data.title: Regina Hall
data.meta_description: Award winning Regina Hall began her acting career in New York City while simultaneously earning a master's degree in Journalism from NYU.
data.text:
Award-winning actress and producer

Award winning Regina Hall began her acting career in New York City while simultaneously earning a master's degree in Journalism from NYU. With numerous ï¬lm and television credits to her name, Hall is one of Hollywoodâs most sought-after actresses and producers.

Hall will soon be seen starring in Searchlight Pictures original rock opera OâDESSA, set in a post-apocalyptic future, alongside Sadie Sink, Murray Bartlett, and Kelvin Harrison Jr. Most recently, Hall reprised her role as Candace in Peacockâs âThe Best Man: The Final Chaptersâ starring alongside Taye Diggs, Nia Long, and Morris Chestnut. The series catches up with the beloved characters from the ï¬lm franchise âTHE BEST MANâ and âTHE BEST MAN HOLIDAY.â Hall received an NAACP Image Award nomination.

Quickly establishing herself as a producer to watch, Hall produced and starred in two of the headlining features of the 2022 Sundance Film Festival: the mega church dark comedy HONK FOR JESUS, SAVE YOUR SOUL opposite Sterling K. Brown and the occult drama MASTER for Amazon Prime. Hall received critical acclaim for both performances as well as a nomination for an Independent Spirit Award and an NAACP Image Award. That same year, Hall starred in the #1 Netï¬ix comedy âME TIMEâ opposite Kevin Hart and Mark Wahlberg.

2021 was a year to watch Hall on television. She starred in the celebrated David E. Kelley Hulu drama âNine Perfect Strangersâ, with a cast ensemble including Nicole Kidman and Melissa McCarthy earning her critical acclaim and an NAACP Image Award as well as âDawn Darcyâ in the hit Showtime comedy series âBlack Monday,â for which she appeared opposite Don Cheadle for three seasons. She also served as producer on the project.

In 2017, Hall starred in the fan favorite âGIRLS TRIPâ alongside Jada Pinkett Smith, Queen Latifah, and Tiffany Haddish. The ï¬lm was a global hit bringing in more than $140 million worldwide and was one of the yearâs biggest and most talked-about ï¬lms. The following year, Hall became the ï¬rst African American actress to ever win a New York Film Critics Circle award for Best Actress for her role in Andrew Bujalskiâs SUPPORT THE GIRLS.

Other past ï¬lms include: âBREAKING NEWS IN YUBA COUNTYâ with Allison Janney and Mila Kunis, âSHAFTâ opposite Samuel L. Jackson, âSUPPORT GIRLS,â âTHE HATE U GIVEâ with Issa Rae and Amanda Stenberg, âWHEN THE BOUGH BREAKS,â âBARBERSHOP 3,â âTHINK LIKE A MAN TOOâ a sequel to Screen Gemsâ âTHINK LIKE A MAN,â âABOUT LAST

NIGHT,â âLAW ABIDING CITIZEN,â âPAID IN FULL,â and âSCARY MOVIE,â as well as its three sequels. Hall also had supporting roles in âLOVE AND BASKETBALLâ and âDISAPPEARING ACTS.â On television, she appeared in guest roles on âGrandfathered,â âInsecure,â and âBlack-ish.â Other credits include âWITH THIS RING,â âMarried,â âLaw & Order: LAâ and âAlly McBeal.â
